page.title: 10POULTRY FARMING,TACOLNESTON
page.content:
{Poultry farming at "The Spinneys" } began in 1961 with units housing 10,000 laying birds & survived until the end of the decade when houses were converted for pullet rearing.With the reluctance of egg producers to sign contracts with rearers this operation became untenable.The unit now produces 16,000 table birds every 10 weeks, usually obtaining weight in excess of 6lbs.Throughout, beagle puppies have been reared as a sideline.
{Woodside Turkey Farm}owned by a company in Diss has 11 acres with 2 poultry houses containing 1200 birds, these are breeding stock 10% of which are males.The hatching eggs are taken to Lincoln for incubation.
